title: Drawing, "Design for a Teapot", ca. 1920–40
medium: Pen and black ink, brown ink,  yellow color pencil (verso), graphite on cream tracing paper
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and black ink at lower center: THEIERE;  at lower right: J.P./35; in graphite at upper right: trop petite (underlined); to right: No II.
creditline: Gift of John Finguerra in memory of his brother Jim Finguerra
description:
Oval shaped teapot with flared sides drawn in plan and elevation, wide lip decorated on the top with a band indicated in yellow color pencil. rounded lid surmounted by a cylindeical finial decorated on either side with a circular boss, continuing in a band along the top of the lid toward handle indicated in brown ink and graphite. C-scroll handle decorated at the top with motif similar to finial indicated in brown ink and graphite. Body with applied reeded band which attaches handle to body. Raised on a tapering base decorated with two applied  bands indicated in yellow color pencil. Underdrawing in graphite of teapot in golden section.
Puiforcat fabrication #: 9070 (probably)
